column3:
Concept ACK, of course, though to be honest I'm not sure there is much value to spending the time to run this for every PR and merge. RISC-V is not sufficiently different from the other architectures, and we don't have any RISC-V specific assembly code.

If we're going to test on wildly different architectures I'd prefer a big-endian MIPS run or such (see #6466).
Makes sense, and the `qemu-riscv64` is only available on Ubuntu Cosmic, not Bionic (https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/qemu-user).
